# Contributing Guidelines

All forms of contribution will be greatly appreciated, whether pull requests, bug reports, or suggestions.
Contributions help improve and grow projects for everyone. Please take a moment to review these guidelines before submitting your changes.

Sticking to these guidelines promotes a respectful and productive experience for contributors and maintainers alike.

---

## Getting Started
1. Fork this repository.
2. Create a new branch for your changes.  
   Example: `feature/new-function` or `fix/bug-description`
3. Make your edits or additions.
4. Commit your work with a clear message describing what you did.
5. Push your branch and open a pull request.

## Code Standards
- Keep your code organized and easy to read.
- Follow existing naming conventions and structure.
- Test your changes before submitting a pull request.

## Reporting Issues
If you find a bug or have a suggestion:
1. Check existing issues to avoid duplicates.
2. Open a new issue with:
   - A clear title and description.
   - Steps to reproduce (if itâ€™s a bug).
   - Screenshots or logs (if applicable).

## Notes
- Contributions of any size are welcome.
- Please keep discussions respectful and constructive.

Thank you for your interest in contributing!
